title: New: Windbreaker – I Hate My Soul
content:
Having been raised on The Clash, The Adicts and Stiff Little Finger, Boston’s Windbreaker aka Darin Thompson, fits in perfectly with my 70’s punk tastes.

A jagged guitar riff that isn’t too far from the likes of White Riot or Rock The Casbah, I Hate My Soul is the third track from Thompson, and continues the development of his emotionally unstable pop-punk that’s sure to seep under your skin. Windbreaker releases his debut EP Let It Go on 11 November through Heart Throb Records

now I know why
that song you tried
to sing to death
was relevant
it perched my soul
the pitch seeped in
now I should sleep
and make amends
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
